item.title: Max lvl (surely simple?)
item.dc:creator: @I_Uk_0wn4g3_I I Uk 0wn4g3 I
item.description:
@I_Uk_0wn4g3_I wrote:

[code]

public int getXPForLevel(int level) {
	int points = 0;
	int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= level; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		if (lvl >= level) {
			return output;
		}
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
	}
	return 0;
}

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
	int points = 0;
	int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 150.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
		if (output >= exp) {
			return lvl;
		}
	}
	return 99;
}[/code]

THIS IS WHAT YOU LOT ARE SAYING TO CHANGE BUT YET IM STILL LEVEL 185 WHEN I LOG IN AND THE LVLS ARE 99… !

Read full topic

item.title: Max lvl (surely simple?)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

look for this

	public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
		int points = 0;
		int output = 0;

		for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 135; lvl++) {
			points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
			output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
			if (output >= exp) {
				return lvl;
			}
		}
		return 135;
	}

where it says 135 is where the level is changed
where it says lvl + 300.0 is the exp for level the less exp the eaiser it is to level the more the more chanllenging

hope this helps

Read full topic
